unnormalised: Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have been net buyers for the past 3 trading sessions, injecting approximately $500 million into the Indian equity market. This inflow has further strengthened the rupee, which is currently trading at ₹83.20 against the US dollar. Experts predict that this trend will continue in the short term, provided global economic conditions remain stable.
normalised: Foreign institutional investors (F-I-I-s) have been net buyers for the past three trading sessions, injecting approximately dollar five hundred million into the Indian equity market. This inflow has further strengthened the rupee, which is currently trading at rupee eighty three point two zero against the U-S dollar. Experts predict that this trend will continue in the short term, provided global economic conditions remain stable.
